intro: Hieracium eutrichum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is typically found in moist meadows and grasslands. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowering heads consist of yellow disc flowers surrounded by pale green to reddish bracts. Hieracium eutrichum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
